title: Caribbean Drug Boat Strikes - Potential War Crimes
summary: 22+ strikes on boats have killed at least 87 people. September 2 strike: After initial strike left two survivors clinging to wreckage, follow-up strike ordered to kill them. Washington Post: Hegseth gave verbal order to 'kill everybody.' Military manual says firing on shipwrecks is illegal; experts say may constitute war crime. UK stopped sharing intelligence over concerns strikes are illegal. No evidence boats were carrying drugs or posed threat. Bipartisan congressional investigations launched.
